title: Search Engines - MozMoz logoMenu openMenu closeSearchMoz logo
description: Your all-in-one suite of SEO essentials.
content: By: Samuel Mangialavori October 21, 2019 5 Things You Should Know About "People Also Ask" & How to Take Advantage Advanced SEO | Search Engines People Also Ask boxes represent growing opportunity in the SERPs, but they're not the most straightforward SERP feature around. Learn all about PAAs and how you can start optimizing for them today. Read this post By: Dr. Peter J. Meyers September 24, 2019 Google Review Stars Drop by 14% Search Engines | Local SEO On September 16, Google announced that they would be restricting review stars in SERPs. According to our data, page-1 SERPs with review stars dropped 14% over a two-day period, with much larger drops in Real Estate and Finance. Read this post By: Ruth Burr Reedy August 26, 2019 Lead Volume vs. Lead Quality for SEO Search Engines | Marketing Industry When your client told you they wanted to focus on lead volume, they weren’t lying to you — it’s just that their needs have changed since having that conversation. Read this post By: Miriam Ellis August 13, 2019 How to Get a Customer to Edit Their Negative Review Local SEO | Search Engines In so many cases, negative reviews are neither punishment nor the end of the road — they are an opportunity. Read this post By: Laurel Taylor July 29, 2019 Empathetic Consulting: 3 Things to Remember When Working With Other Teams Search Engines | Marketing Industry | SEO Consulting Consulting with other teams always entails organizational and emotional nuance that you may not be privy to. Read this post K By: Kate Morris July 24, 2019 The Ultimate Guide to SEO Meta Tags Search Engines | On-page SEO | SEO Basics In 2019, meta tags are still important. But which meta tags are absolutely necessary, which are dependent on your situation, and which should you absolutely ignore or remove? Read this post By: Faisal Anderson July 22, 2019 Spying On Google: 5 Ways to Use Log File Analysis To Reveal Invaluable SEO Insights Advanced SEO | Search Engines | Technical SEO Most SEO Professionals have never used Log File Analysis, but without it, they are missing out on unique and invaluable insights that regular crawling tools just can’t produce. Read this post By: Britney Muller July 12, 2019 How to Target Featured Snippet Opportunities — Best of Whiteboard Friday Whiteboard Friday | Search Engines Once you've identified where the opportunity to nab a featured snippet lies, how do you go about targeting it? Read this post By: Miriam Ellis July 8, 2019 New Things I’ve Learned About Google Review Likes Local SEO | Search Engines Our local search expert looked closely at the review like button — its uses, abuses, and industry opinions about it. She even spoke to three different Google reps. Here's what she discovered. Read this post By: Lindsay Halsey July 3, 2019 How to Talk to Your Clients in a Language They Understand Search Engines | Marketing Industry | SEO Consulting The words and phrases that mean a lot to us as SEO professionals mean little or nothing to our customers. Read this post By: Cyrus Shepard July 1, 2019 All Links Are Not Created Equal: 20 Graphics on Google's Valuation of Links Search Engines | On-page SEO | Link Building In this post, we'll walk you through 20 principles of link valuation that have been observed and tested by SEOs. Read this post By: Dr. Peter J. Meyers June 19, 2019 Did Google's Site Diversity Update Live Up to its Promise? Search Engines | Advanced SEO Deep dive into Google's site diversity update. Across 10,000 keywords, SERPs with 3-5 organic results from one site improved marginally. There was no improvement in SERPs with 6-10 results from a single site. Read this post By: Roger MozBot June 17, 2019 SEO Whitepaper: How Distance and Intent Shape a Local Pack Competitive Research | Search Engines | Marketing Industry When every SERP is a local SERP, understanding how Google creates them is essential — which is why we’re unpacking the local pack. Read this post By: Ian Booth June 4, 2019 Google E-A-T SEO: How to Create Content Google Wants Search Engines | Marketing Industry Over the past few months, you’ve probably seen the buzzword (or acronym, rather) “E-A-T” floating around. While this term has been in the lexicon of many SEOs for quite a while now, since the major Google algorithm update in August 2018 (AKA “the medic update”), a big bright spotlight has been shone on Google’s “E-A-T”. Read this post
